channel.title: Changing the Server-IP on a client that has no IP change option
channel.description: Um I'm using a client made for a specific source. Though I'm only putting the server up for fun just to joke around with friends and in order for them to actually play the source I'm using they will have to download the client, but I've noticed that the client has no option to change the IP of the server that you want to log into. I was wondering if anyone knew how to change the IP in the client folders somewhere... I'm using the Demise Source and the Demise Client.. but I'm sure most clients are generally the same so I'd greatly appreciate it if someone could help me out. Thanks! :]

item.title: Changing the Server-IP on a client that has no IP change option
item.dc:creator: @Mariokillu Mariokillu
item.description:
@Mariokillu wrote:

OmgItsAlex:

[quote]public static String server = “localhost”; // ip - 127.0.0.1 localhost[/quote]

Ya, thats the right one.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing the Server-IP on a client that has no IP change option

item.title: Changing the Server-IP on a client that has no IP change option
item.dc:creator: @elf_run1 elf run1
item.description:
@elf_run1 wrote:

OmgItsAlex:

[quote]public static String server = “localhost”; // ip - 127.0.0.1 localhost[/quote]

yea thats it but remember it might also be in gui.java or Jframe.java mine dose try both just changed the “localhost” to your servers ip like

public static String server = "servername.no-ip.biz"; // ip change<--

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the Server-IP on a client that has no IP change option
item.dc:creator: @dgk_all_day1 dgk_all_day
item.description:
@dgk_all_day1 wrote:

try opening client.java and search for 127.0.0.1
if its not in there
try find and open gui.java and search for 127.0.0.1
you need to change those to your no-ip adress or your ip address recomend no-ip tho
if its not there idk tbh

Read full topic
